javax.microedition.rms

Class RecordEnumeration

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.microedition.rms.RecordEnumeration

  • public class RecordEnumeration
extends java.lang.Object
    The RecordEnumeration class provides methods to manage and iterate over records.

    • Field Summary

      Cursor cursor 
      Cursor old_cursor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkDestroy()
      Checks if the cursor is null and throws an IllegalStateException if it is.
      void destroy()
      Destroys the current cursor by setting it to null after performing necessary checks.
      int nextRecordId()
      Moves the cursor to the next record and returns the record ID.
      void reset()
      Resets the cursor to the old cursor if available, otherwise throws an IllegalStateException.

    • Method Detail

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroys the current cursor by setting it to null after performing necessary checks.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the cursor is already null.

      • nextRecordId

        public int nextRecordId()
        Moves the cursor to the next record and returns the record ID.
        Returns:
        the next record ID, or 0 if there are no more records.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the cursor to the old cursor if available, otherwise throws an IllegalStateException.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the old cursor is null.

      • checkDestroy

        public void checkDestroy()
        Checks if the cursor is null and throws an IllegalStateException if it is.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the cursor is null.
